qas.question: What continent's laws developed alongside those of the Church?
In which types of law can elements of canon law be seen?

answers.text: modern civil law and common law

qas.question: Who stated that Church law can be seen in the growth of civil law institutions?
What two regions does Sampel cite as examples of the influence of canon law?
What does Sampel claim had a great impact on?
What law paralleled the legal development of Europe and Latin America?
What was influenced by civil law and common law?
Who said that Canon law has little influence in contemporary society?
What is contained in various institutions of Europe and Asia?

context: The institutions and practices of <b5_0><b6_0>canon law<b6_0/><b5_0/> paralleled the legal development of much of <a0_0>Europe<a0_0/>, and consequently both <a1_0>modern civil law and common law<a1_0/> (legal system) bear the influences of <b8_0>canon law<b8_0/>. <a2_0><b7_0>Edson Luiz Sampel<b7_0/><a2_0/>, a Brazilian expert in canon law, says that canon law is contained in the genesis of various institutes of civil law, such as the law in continental <a3_0>Europe and Latin American<a3_0/> countries. Sampel explains that canon law has significant influence in <a4_0>contemporary society<a4_0/>.
